intro: Stigmaphyllon lineare, commonly known as the linear stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
